citation.article-title: Microbacterium soli sp. nov., an alpha-glucosidase-producing bacterium isolated from soil of a ginseng field
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Microbacterium soli sp. nov.
Microbacterium soli (so′li. L. neut. gen. n. soli of soil, the source of the first strains).
Gram-type-positive, aerobic, non-motile and rod-shaped (about 0.2–0.5 μm wide and 0.5–0.9 μm long) after growth on R2A agar (Difco) at 30 °C for 5 days.
Colonies are circular and pale yellow on R2A agar after 5 days of incubation at 30 °C.
Grows at 25–42 °C, with optimal growth at 30 °C on R2A agar.

Produces acid phosphatase, cysteine arylamidase, α-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucosidase (aesculin hydrolysis), leucine arylamidase, α-mannosidase and valine arylamidase but does not produce arginine dihydrolase, α-fucosidase, β-glucuronidase, lipase (C14), protease (gelatin hydrolysis) and urease.

Produces acid from cellobiose, aesculin, gluconate and trehalose and not from d-adonitol (ribitol), d- or l-arabitol, dulcitol (galactitol), erythritol, d- or l-fucose, glycerol, glycogen, inositol, inulin, 2-ketogluconate, d-lyxose, methyl α-d-mannoside, raffinose, l-rhamnose, sorbitol, l-sorbose, starch, d-tagatose, l-xylose or xylitol.

Does not assimilate acetate, adipate, l-alanine, caprate, citrate, l-fucose, glycogen, l-histidine, 3-hydroxybenzoate, 3-hydroxy-dl-butyrate, inositol, itaconate, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, dl-lactate, l-malate, malonate, melibiose, propionate, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, l-serine, sorbitol, suberate or n-valerate but does assimilate N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, l-arabinose, gluconate, glucose, maltose, mannitol, mannose, phenylacetate, l-proline, salicin and sucrose.
The predominant quinones are MK-12, MK-11 and MK-13.
Major cellular fatty acids are C15 : 0 anteiso, C15 : 0 iso, C16 : 0 iso, C17 : 0 anteiso, C17 : 0 iso and C14 : 0 iso.
Does not reduce nitrate to nitrite or nitrogen gas.
The cell-wall peptidoglycan is of the B2β type, (l-Hsr)–d-Glu→Gly→d-Orn with glycolyl resides.
Cell-wall sugars are galactose and traces of an unknown sugar.
The DNA G+C contents of known strains are 68.9–73.5 mol%.
The type strain, DCY 17T (=KCTC 19237T =LMG 24010T), was isolated from soil of a ginseng field in Daejeon, South Korea.
Four other strains (Ms1–Ms4) were isolated from the same source.
